title: General Immune Support with Supplements, Herbs & Homeopathic Remedies
author: Kiera Lane; N M D; L Ac; Dipl Ac; FABORM
description: Arizona Natural Medicine provides effective healthcare merging Western & Eastern Medicine. Naturopathic physicians primary care specialize in natural medicine, natural therapeutics, Chinese medicine, acupuncture, homeopathy, nutrition, botanical medicine, and drug therapy to provide comprehensive medicine.
cleaned_text: General Immune Support with Supplements, Herbs & Homeopathic Remedies Supporting your general immune system can be done in a number of ways. Specific nutrients, mineral and certain botanicals can provide immune support. You should always consult with your physician before you take herbs or additional vitamins/minerals to ensure it is the best choice for you individually. There are a few key nutrients for immune support. [Vitamin C](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29099763): support epithelial barrier function meaning it helps keep bugs out of the system [Vitamin A](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6162863/): important in supporting immediate immune response [Vitamin D](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3166406/): supports immune response overall [Zinc](https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2013/02/130207131344.htm): supports first-responder cells of immune system Botanical support may include: [Black elderberry](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11399518)(Sambucus nigra): supports immune response and has anti-viral properties - Osha (Ligusticum porter): immune stimulant herb - Garlic and Onion: break up mucus, reduce inflammation, antioxidant effects and antimicrobial - Monolaurin: derived from coconut to support your immune system - Mushrooms: boost your immune response In addition, we offer [homeopathic injections](https://www.aznaturalmedicine.com/services/specialized/heel-injectable-therapy/) such as [Engystol](http://hcp.medinatura.com/docs/engystol-clinical-experiences-1993.pdf) which helps support immune function. Consult with your physician to determine what is best for you to take to support your immune system.
